Subjective: Left ear pain for 2-3 days. Feels like water in ear. Painful after showering. Pain level 0-4, 6-7 after showering. No fever. No painkillers taken. Can't swim due to pain. Clean ear with cotton buds 3 times a week. ICE: Wants pain to go away, concerned about hearing.
Objective: Temp 36.2 C. Ears: Right ear normal. Left ear canal red, swollen, and thick. Eardrum not visible. No signs of infection.
Assessment: Ear canal inflammation, likely due to water exposure and cotton bud use.
Plan: 1. Painkillers: Paracetamol up to 4000mg/day. 2. Ear drops: Anti-inflammatory, 3 times a day for 1 week. 3. No cotton bud use. 4. Keep ear dry for 1 week. 5. Follow-up in 1 week.
